content:
Diagnosis
	1. Small cell carcinoma of ovary, hypercalcemic type
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative intent

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Primary debulking surgery - total abdominal hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, omentectomy

	Chemotherapy
	1. BEP protocol (Bleomycin, Etoposide, Cisplatin) commenced 12 Feb 2024
	2. Currently on cycle 4 of planned 6 cycles

	Clinical studies
	Not enrolled

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on imaging

	Current issues
	Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy
	Intermittent nausea
	Mild tinnitus

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today prior to cycle 4 BEP. Latest CT performed on 15/4/24 shows stable disease with no new sites of disease. Primary site changes and omental disease remain stable compared to post-operative imaging. Tumour markers remain within normal range. Performance status remains 1.

Treatment tolerance has been reasonable though experiencing increasing peripheral neuropathy affecting hands and feet (grade 2). Reports ongoing intermittent nausea between cycles despite optimized antiemetics. New onset tinnitus noted but mild and non-intrusive. Blood tests today show stable renal function, normal magnesium, and adequate bone marrow reserve for cycle 4.

On examination, peripheral neuropathy confirmed with reduced vibration sense to ankles bilaterally. Abdomen soft, well-healed surgical scar. No clinical evidence of disease progression.

	Further investigations
	Repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after cycle 6
	Audiometry to document tinnitus

	Medication prescribed
	Domperidone 10mg TDS PRN added

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks pre cycle 5

	Required GP actions
	Weekly FBC, U&E monitoring to continue
	Please monitor neuropathy symptoms

cancer_timeline.value: Primary debulking surgery - total abdominal hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, omentectomy
CT shows stable disease with no new sites of disease. Primary site changes and omental disease stable compared to post-operative imaging

patient_facts.value: Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting hands and feet
Reduced vibration sense to ankles bilaterally
Blood tests show stable renal function, normal magnesium, and adequate bone marrow reserve

status_updates.value: Stage IIIB small cell ovarian cancer receiving BEP chemotherapy. Stable disease on imaging with acceptable toxicity profile allowing continuation of treatment
Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy, intermittent nausea, and mild tinnitus
Proceeding with cycle 4 BEP, added domperidone for nausea control
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after cycle 6, audiometry to document tinnitus
